summary_md: This round established core structural lemmas for finite Whitney triangulations of the disk and proved several small k-null cases. Main verified facts: G is K4-free, so maximal cliques of the primal are exactly the facial triangles; the link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle, forcing interior degree ≥4; for an interior vertex v the incident-face set T(v) is a maximal clique in kG; any interior face t with all three edges interior yields N(t) (t plus the three adjacent faces) which induces a maximal K4 in kG; and kG is connected when G has ≥2 faces. k-nullness was proved for fans (one interior vertex), the two-triangle disk, and the hexagon-with-central-triangle (k^2G ≅ K1). Remaining major gaps are a full classification of maximal cliques of kG (conjecture: every non-star maximal clique is some N(t)) and a completed ear-removal induction for the outerplanar case. Citations: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary.
one_line_summary: Structural lemmas proved; some small disk triangulations are k-null; clique-classification and outerplanar proof remain.
highlights: G is K4-free ⇒ maximal cliques of G are exactly facial triangles.
The link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle, so interior vertices have degree ≥4.
For interior v, T(v) (faces incident to v) is a maximal clique in kG.
For an interior face t with all three edges interior, N(t) (t plus its three adjacent faces) induces a maximal K4 in kG.
kG is connected whenever G has at least two faces.
Verified k-null families: fans (one interior vertex), two-triangle disk, and hexagon with central triangle (k^2G ≅ K1).
next_questions: Prove every non-star maximal clique of kG has size ≤4 and equals N(t) for some interior face t (rigorous classification).
Complete the outerplanar (no interior vertices) case via ear-removal induction: show k^2G is acyclic/has a suitable monotone invariant to deduce k-nullness.
Exhaustively enumerate small disk Whitney triangulations (esp. interior degrees 4–5) to search for counterexamples or supporting data.
